template.name: Template DB Oracle by ODBC
template.description:
1. Create an Oracle user for monitoring.
2. Set the user name and password in host macros ({$ORACLE.USER} and {$ORACLE.PASSWORD}). Do not forget to install the Microsoft ODBC driver on the Zabbix server or the Zabbix proxy. See Oracle documentation for instructions: https://www.oracle.com/database/technologies/releasenote-odbc-ic.html. Note! Credentials in the odbc.ini do not work for Oracle. The "Service's TCP port state" item uses {HOST.CONN} and {$ORACLE.PORT} macros to check the availability of the listener.
Template tooling version used: 0.37

item.name: Oracle: Get all databases
item.params: SELECT NAME as DBNAME, DECODE(open_mode, 'MOUNTED', 1, 'READ ONLY', 2, 'READ WRITE', 3, 'READ ONLY WITH APPLY', 4, 'MIGRATE', 5, 0) AS open_status, DECODE(role, 'SNAPSHOT STANDBY', 1, 'LOGICAL STANDBY', 2, 'PHYSICAL STANDBY', 3, 'PRIMARY', 4, 'FAR SYNC', 5, 0) AS role FROM ( SELECT name, open_mode, Null AS ROLE FROM v$pdbs UNION SELECT name, open_mode, database_role FROM v$database );
item.description: Get list of all (PDB, CDB, No-CDB) databases on instansce.

item.name: Oracle: Get archive log info
item.params: SELECT d.dest_name, DECODE (d.status, 'VALID',3, 'DEFERRED', 2, 'ERROR', 1, 0) AS status, d.log_sequence, d.error FROM v$archive_dest d , v$database db WHERE d.status != 'INACTIVE' AND db.log_mode = 'ARCHIVELOG';

item.name: Oracle: Get instance state
item.params: SELECT INSTANCE_NAME, HOST_NAME, VERSION || '-' || EDITION AS VERSION, floor((SYSDATE - startup_time)*60*60*24) AS UPTIME, decode(status,'STARTED',1,'MOUNTED',2,'OPEN',3,'OPEN MIGRATE',4, 0) AS STATUS, decode(archiver,'STOPPED',1,'STARTED',2,'FAILED',3, 0) AS ARCHIVER, decode(INSTANCE_ROLE,'PRIMARY_INSTANCE',1,'SECONDARY_INSTANCE',2, 0) AS INSTANCE_ROLE FROM v$instance;
item.description: The item gets state of the current instance.

item.name: Oracle: Get system metrics
item.params: SELECT 'sysmetrics' AS TYPE, METRIC_NAME, VALUE FROM V$SYSMETRIC WHERE GROUP_ID = 2 UNION SELECT 'parameters' AS TYPE, NAME AS METRIC_NAME, to_number(VALUE) FROM V$SYSTEM_PARAMETER WHERE NAME IN ('sessions','processes','db_files') UNION SELECT 'sessions' AS TYPE , status||'_'||TYPE AS METRIC_NAME, COUNT(*) as VALUE FROM v$session GROUP BY status, TYPE UNION SELECT 'sessions' AS TYPE ,'total' , COUNT(*) as VALUE FROM v$session UNION SELECT 'pga' AS TYPE, name, value FROM v$pgastat UNION SELECT 'fra', 'space_limit', space_limit FROM v$recovery_file_dest def UNION SELECT 'fra', 'space_used', space_used FROM v$recovery_file_dest def UNION SELECT 'fra', 'space_reclaimable', space_reclaimable FROM v$recovery_file_dest def UNION SELECT 'fra', 'number_of_files', number_of_files FROM v$recovery_file_dest def UNION SELECT 'fra', 'usable_pct', DECODE(space_limit, 0, 0,(100-(100 *(space_used - space_reclaimable)/ space_limit))) FROM v$recovery_file_dest UNION SELECT 'fra', 'restore_point', COUNT(*) FROM v$restore_point UNION SELECT 'processes', 'procnum', COUNT(*) FROM v$process UNION SELECT 'datafile', 'count', COUNT(*) FROM v$datafile UNION SELECT 'SGA Pool', pool, SUM(bytes) FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool IN ( 'java pool', 'large pool' ) GROUP BY pool UNION SELECT 'SGA Pool', 'shared pool', SUM(bytes) FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool = 'shared pool' AND name NOT IN ('library cache', 'dictionary cache', 'free memory','sql area') UNION SELECT 'SGA component name', name, bytes FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool IS NULL AND name IN ('log_buffer', 'fixed_sga') UNION SELECT 'SGA component name', 'buffer_cache', SUM(bytes) FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool IS NULL AND name IN ('buffer_cache', 'db_block_buffers');
item.description: The item gets system metric values.

item.name: Oracle: Get Tablespaces stats
item.params: SELECT df.tablespace_name AS tablespace, df.type AS TYPE, SUM(df.bytes) AS used_bytes, SUM(df.max_bytes) AS max_bytes, SUM(f.free) AS free_bytes, ROUND(SUM(df.bytes)/ SUM(df.max_bytes)* 100, 2) AS used_pct, DECODE(df.status, 'ONLINE', 1, 'OFFLINE', 2, 'READ ONLY', 3, 0) AS status FROM ( SELECT ddf.file_id, dt.contents AS TYPE, dt.STATUS , ddf.file_name, ddf.tablespace_name, TRUNC(ddf.bytes) AS bytes, TRUNC(GREATEST(ddf.bytes, ddf.maxbytes)) AS max_bytes FROM dba_data_files ddf, dba_tablespaces dt WHERE ddf.tablespace_name = dt.tablespace_name ) df, ( SELECT TRUNC(SUM(bytes)) AS FREE, file_id FROM dba_free_space GROUP BY file_id ) f WHERE df.file_id = f.file_id (+) GROUP BY df.tablespace_name, df.TYPE, df.status UNION ALL SELECT Y.name AS tablespace_name, Y.type AS TYPE, SUM(Y.bytes) AS bytes, SUM(Y.max_bytes) AS max_bytes, MAX(NVL(Y.free_bytes, 0)) AS FREE, ROUND(SUM(Y.bytes)/ SUM(Y.max_bytes)* 100, 2) AS used_pct, DECODE(Y.tbs_status, 'ONLINE', 1, 'OFFLINE', 2, 'READ ONLY', 3, 0) AS status FROM ( SELECT dtf.tablespace_name AS name, dt.contents AS TYPE, dt.STATUS AS tbs_status, dtf.status AS status, dtf.bytes AS bytes, (SELECT ((f.total_blocks - s.tot_used_blocks)* vp.value) FROM ( SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(used_blocks) tot_used_blocks FROM gv$sort_segment WHERE tablespace_name != 'DUMMY' GROUP BY tablespace_name) s, ( SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(blocks) total_blocks FROM dba_temp_files WHERE tablespace_name != 'DUMMY' GROUP BY tablespace_name) f, ( SELECT value FROM v$parameter WHERE name = 'db_block_size') vp WHERE f.tablespace_name = s.tablespace_name AND f.tablespace_name = dtf.tablespace_name ) AS free_bytes, CASE WHEN dtf.maxbytes = 0 THEN dtf.bytes ELSE dtf.maxbytes END AS max_bytes FROM sys.dba_temp_files dtf, sys.dba_tablespaces dt WHERE dtf.tablespace_name = dt.tablespace_name ) Y GROUP BY Y.name, Y.TYPE, Y.tbs_status ORDER BY tablespace;
item.description: Get tablespaces stats.

item.name: Oracle: Service's TCP port state
item.description: Test the availability of Oracle on TCP port.

item.name: Oracle: Active parallel sessions
item.description: The number of active parallel sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Active serial sessions
item.description: The number of active serial sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Average active sessions
item.description: The average active sessions at a point in time. It is the number of sessions that are either working or waiting.

item.name: Oracle: Archiver state
item.description: Automatic archiving status.

item.name: Oracle: Buffer cache hit ratio
item.description: Ratio of buffer cache hits. (LogRead - PhyRead)/LogRead

item.name: Oracle: Global Cache Blocks Corrupted
item.description: The number of blocks that encountered a corruption or checksum failure during interconnect.

item.name: Oracle: Global Cache Blocks Lost
item.description: The number of global cache blocks lost

item.name: Oracle: Cursor Cache Hit Ratio
item.description: Ratio of cursor cache hits. CursorCacheHit/SoftParse

item.name: Oracle: Database CPU time ratio
item.description: Calculated by dividing the total CPU used by the database by the Oracle time model statistic DB time.

item.name: Oracle: Database Wait time ratio
item.description: Wait time: the time that the server process spends waiting for available shared resources (to be released by other server processes) such as latches, locks, data buffers, and so on

item.name: Oracle: Datafiles count
item.description: Current number of datafile.

item.name: Oracle: Datafiles limit
item.description: Max allowable number of datafile.

item.name: Oracle: Disk sort per second
item.description: The number of sorts going to disk per second

item.name: Oracle: Enqueue Timeouts per second
item.description: Enqueue timeouts per second.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Number of files
item.description: Number of files in the fast recovery area

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Number of restore points
Oracle: FRA, Space limit
item.description: Maximum amount of disk space (in bytes) that the database can use for the fast recovery area.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Space reclaimable
item.description: Total amount of disk space (in bytes) that can be created by deleting obsolete, redundant, and other low priority files from the fast recovery area.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Used space
item.description: Amount of disk space (in bytes) used by fast recovery area files created in current and all previous fast recovery areas.

item.name: Oracle: GC CR Block Received per second
item.description: GC CR block received per second.

item.name: Oracle: Instance hostname
item.description: Name of the host machine.

trigger.name: Oracle: Instance hostname has changed (new hostname received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB Instance hostname has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Oracle: Instance name
item.description: Name of the instance.

trigger.name: Oracle: Instance name has changed (new name received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB Instance name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Oracle: Instance role
item.description: Indicates whether the instance is an active instance or an inactive secondary instance.

item.name: Oracle: Instance status
item.description: Status of the instance.

item.name: Oracle: Library Cache Hit Ratio
item.description: Ratio of library cache hits. Hits/Pins

item.name: Oracle: Logons per second
item.description: The number of logon attempts.

item.name: Oracle: Long table scans per second
item.description: The number of long table scans per second. A table is considered 'long' if the table is not cached and if its high-water mark is greater than 5 blocks.

item.name: Oracle: Memory sorts ratio
item.description: The percentage of sorts (from ORDER BY clauses or index building) that are done to disk vs in-memory.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Global memory bound
item.description: Maximum size of a work area executed in automatic mode.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Aggregate target parameter
item.description: Current value of the PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET initialization parameter. If this parameter is not set, then its value is 0 and automatic management of PGA memory is disabled.

item.name: Oracle: Physical Reads Bytes per second
item.description: Read bytes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical Reads per second
item.description: Reads per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical Writes Bytes per second
item.description: Write bytes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical Writes per second
item.description: Writes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Processes limit
item.description: User processes.

item.name: Oracle: Rows per sort
item.description: The average number of rows per sort for all types of sorts performed.

item.name: Oracle: SQL Service response time
item.description: SQL service response time in seconds.

item.name: Oracle: Active background sessions
item.description: The number of active background sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Active user sessions
item.description: The number of active user sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Session count
item.description: Session count.

item.name: Oracle: Inactive user sessions
item.description: The number of inactive user sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions limit
item.description: User and system sessions.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, buffer cache
item.description: The size of the cache of standard blocks.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, fixed
item.description: The fixed SGA is an internal housekeeping area.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, java pool
item.description: Memory is allocated from the java pool.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, large pool
item.description: Memory is allocated from the large pool.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, log buffer
item.description: The number of bytes allocated for the redo log buffer.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, shared pool
item.description: Memory is allocated from the shared pool.

item.name: Oracle: Shared Pool Free %
item.description: Shared pool free memory percent. Free/Total

item.name: Oracle: Total sorts per user call
item.description: Total sorts per user call.

item.name: Oracle: Temp space used
item.description: Temp space used.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total allocated
item.description: Current amount of PGA memory allocated by the instance. The Oracle Database attempts to keep this number below the value of the PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET initialization parameter. However, it is possible for the PGA allocated to exceed that value by a small percentage and for a short period of time when the work area workload is increasing very rapidly or when PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET is set to a small value.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total freeable
item.description: Number of bytes of PGA memory in all processes that could be freed back to the operating system.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total inuse
item.description: Indicates how much PGA memory is currently consumed by work areas. This number can be used to determine how much memory is consumed by other consumers of the PGA memory (for example, PL/SQL or Java).

item.name: Oracle: Uptime
item.description: Oracle instance uptime in seconds.

trigger.name: Oracle: Failed to fetch info data (or no data for 30m)
trigger.description: Zabbix has not received data for items for the last 30 minutes.

dependency.name: Oracle: Port {$ORACLE.PORT} is unavailable
dependency.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:net.tcp.service[tcp,{HOST.CONN},{$ORACLE.PORT}].max(#3)}=0 and {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:proc.num[,,,"tnslsnr LISTENER"].max(#3)}>0

item.name: Oracle: User rollbacks per second
item.description: The number of times that users manually issue the ROLLBACK statement or an error occurred during a user's transactions.

item.name: Oracle: Version
item.description: Oracle Server version.

trigger.name: Oracle: Version has changed (new version value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB version has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Oracle: Number of LISTENER processes
item.description: Number of LISTENER processes running

trigger.name: Oracle: LISTENER process is not running

discovery_rule.name: Archive log discovery
discovery_rule.params: SELECT d.dest_name FROM v$archive_dest d , v$database db WHERE d.status != 'INACTIVE' AND db.log_mode = 'ARCHIVELOG';

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Last sequence
item_prototype.description: Identifies the sequence number of the last archived redo log to be archived

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Status
item_prototype.description: Identifies the current status of the destination: 1 - 'Valid', 2 - 'Dederred',3 - 'Error', 0 - 'Unknown'

trigger_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Log Archive is not valid
trigger_prototype.description: ARL destination not in 3 - Valid or 2 - Deferred.

discovery_rule.name: Database discovery

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status
item_prototype.description: 1 - 'MOUNTED', 2 - 'READ WRITE', 3 - 'READ ONLY', 4 - 'READ ONLY WITH APPLY' (A physical standby database is open in real-time query mode)

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB has a MOUNTED state.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle DB open status has changed. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Role has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle DB role has changed. Ack to close.

discovery_rule.name: Tablespace discovery

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespase is OFFLINE
trigger_prototype.description: The tablespase is in offline state.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle tablespace status has changed. Ack to close.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace Usage is is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}% for 5m)

dependency.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace Usage is is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m)

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace Usage is is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m)

macro.description: Maximum percentage of database files for trigger expression.
This macro is used in database discovery. It can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
This macro is used in database discovery. It can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Maximum percentage of PGA usage for trigger expression.
Maximum percentage of active processes for trigger expression.
Maximum percentage of active sessions for trigger expression.
This macro is used in tablespace discovery. It can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
This macro is used in tablespace discovery. It can be overridden on the host or linked template level.
Maximum percentage of used tablespace for high trigger expression.
Maximum percentage of used tablespace for warning trigger expression.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:net.tcp.service[tcp,{HOST.CONN},{$ORACLE.PORT}].max(#3)}=0 and {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:proc.num[,,,"tnslsnr LISTENER"].max(#3)}>0
trigger.name: Oracle: Port {$ORACLE.PORT} is unavailable
trigger.description: The TCP port of the Oracle Server service is currently unavailable.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.processes_count.last()} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.processes_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many active processes (over {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Active process are using more than {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}% of the available Process number

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.session_count.last()} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.session_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many active sessions (over {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Active sessions are using more than {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}% of the available sessions

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.db_files_count.last()} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.db_files_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many database files (over {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Number of datafiles more than {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}% of the available datafile files limit.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.total_pga_used.last()} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.pga_target.last()} > {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Total PGA inuse is too high (over {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Total PGA inuse is more than {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}% of PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET.
